quizlist.question: The ability to identify a person from from anoymised data should be:
Describe the 'likely, reasonable' test
quizlist.option1: You should make all reasonable attempts to limit the risk that a person is identified
quizlist.option2: You should make all reasonable attempts to identify an individual
quizlist.option3: You should completely remove the likelihood of identification

quizlist.question: Select an example of good governance.
quizlist.option1: Ensuring someone with the suitable skills and knowledge oversees the anonymisation process
quizlist.option2: Conducting a privacy impact assessment that supersedes the ADF
quizlist.option3: Ensuring you have procedures for making anonymisation problematic or difficult to achieve in practice

quizlist.question: Select an example of good governance.
quizlist.option1: Documenting clearly and accurately the anonymisation process
quizlist.option2: Relying on up-to-date guidance and anonymisation case law and consider the legal framework to be sufficient on its own

quizlist.question: Select an example of good governance.
quizlist.option1: Providing all staff with the basics for anonymisation in their induction training
quizlist.option2: Providing advanced training for the anonymisation experts only
quizlist.option3: Considering the possibility that things go wrong so small that you can ignore thinking about it
